contentrichtext.text: {{distinguish2|the [[University of Texas at San Antonio]]}} The '''University of San Antonio''' was a [[United Methodist Church|Methodist]] institution of [[higher education]] located in [[San Antonio]], [[Texas]], USA. It was founded as '''San Antonio Female College''' in 1894. The name was changed to '''Westmoorland College''' in 1918 and to the University of San Antonio in 1937. In 1942, the campus was taken over by [[Trinity University (Texas)|Trinity University]], which adopted the [[alumni]] of the University of San Antonio. Trinity, in turn, built a new campus and left the old University of San Antonio campus in 1952. ''Note'': This university was not related to the later [[University of Texas at San Antonio]] (UTSA). ==External links== * {{Handbook of Texas|id=kbs08|name=San Antonio Female College}} {{coord missing|Texas}} [[Category:Universities and colleges in San Antonio, Texas]] [[Category:Educational institutions established in 1894]] [[Category:Defunct universities and colleges in Texas]] {{Texas-university-stub}}
